bestBHT.bht: The mission of missionaries is exemplified when they are sent out as harmless, innocent, profitable, and defenseless creatures amidst spiteful, malicious, cunning, and cruel men. Their journey involves going into different locations to make ready for Christ, reminding us of the urgency and challenges they willingly embrace. Interestingly, the Seventy are not bound by restrictions to only reach out to certain people but are encouraged to go wherever needed. This portrays a powerful picture of the sacrifices made by missionaries as they share the message of Christ with the world.

Marvin Vincent: I send forth [αποστελλω] . See on Matthew 10:2.
Philip Schaff: Go your ways. This, too, implies urgency.
The Seventy are not forbidden to go to the Gentiles and Samaritans (Matthew 10:5).
Possibly they did visit the latter; and besides their route was made known to them in advance, which was not the case when the Twelve were sent out.
Archibald T. Robertson: As lambs...Pathetic picture of the risks of missionaries for Christ.
They take their life in their hands.
John Gill: Go your ways,... Into all the villages, towns, cities, and places, where he directed them to go, to make ready for him.
Behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves; as harmless, innocent, profitable, and defenceless creatures, among spiteful, malicious, cunning, and cruel men.

bhtAttempts.bht: The passage depicts a poignant image of the risks and vulnerability that missionaries face as they are sent out as lambs among wolves. The urgency of their mission is emphasized, as they are instructed to go into all the villages, towns, cities, and places to prepare the way. While the specifics of their journey may differ from the Twelve, who were sent out previously, the Seventy are not forbidden to reach out to Gentiles and Samaritans. Overall, this verse serves as a reminder of the challenges that missionaries willingly undertake to share the message of Christ.

The risks and vulnerability faced by missionaries are vividly illustrated in the instruction to go as lambs among wolves. This emphasizes the urgency of their mission, as they are sent into various locations to prepare the way. While the Seventy may have encountered different circumstances from the Twelve, who were sent out earlier, they are not limited in reaching out to Gentiles and Samaritans. This verse serves as a powerful reminder of the challenges that missionaries willingly embrace in order to share the message of Christ.

The instruction to go as lambs among wolves vividly portrays the risks and vulnerability experienced by missionaries. Their urgent mission takes them to various locations to prepare the way for Christ. Similar to the Twelve, the Seventy are not limited in reaching out to both Gentiles and Samaritans. This verse serves as a powerful reminder of the challenges willingly undertaken by missionaries, who go fearlessly into the world to proclaim the message of Christ despite the adversities they may face.

The mission of missionaries is exemplified when they are sent out as harmless, innocent, profitable, and defenseless creatures amidst spiteful, malicious, cunning, and cruel men. Their journey involves going into different locations to make ready for Christ, reminding us of the urgency and challenges they willingly embrace. Interestingly, the Seventy are not bound by restrictions to only reach out to certain people but are encouraged to go wherever needed. This portrays a powerful picture of the sacrifices made by missionaries as they share the message of Christ with the world.

Missionaries are sent out as harmless, innocent, profitable, and defenseless creatures amidst the harshness of the world. They courageously embark on their journeys, facing the risks and challenges that come with sharing the message of Christ. The urgency of their mission is evident as they go into various locations, preparing the way for Christ. The Seventy are not confined to a specific audience, allowing them to reach out to both Gentiles and Samaritans. This verse emphasizes the sacrificial nature of missionary work and the unwavering commitment of those who undertake it.
